tuv.seg: If you adopt a child who is living in a country outside Ireland, the process is called intercountry adoption
Má uchtaíonn tú leanbh atá ina chónaí i dtír lasmuigh d’Éirinn, tugtar uchtú idir thíortha ar an bpróiseas
Adopting a child who is resident in Ireland is called a domestic adoption
Tugtar uchtú intíre ar uchtú leanbh atá ina chónaí in Éirinn
Adoption is the process whereby a child becomes a member of a new family
Is é is uchtú ann ná próiseas trína n-éiríonn leanbh ina bhall de theaghlach nua
It creates a permanent, legal relationship between the adoptive parents and the child
Cruthaíonn sé gaolmhaireacht dhlíthiúil bhuan idir na tuismitheoirí uchtála agus an leanbh
As intercountry adoption is a complex legal process, it is helpful to be aware of the basics of adoption law
Ós rud é gur próiseas casta dlí é uchtú idir thíortha, tá sé ina chabhair eolas a bheith agat ar na gnéithe bunúsacha den dlí um uchtú
• An adoption order secures in law the position of the child in the adoptive family
• Daingníonn ordú uchtaithe seasamh an linbh sa teaghlach uchtála sa dlí
The child is regarded in law as the child of the adoptive parents as if he/she were born to them
Breithnítear sa dlí go bhfuil an leanbh ar leanbh na dtuismitheoirí uchtála faoi is dá mbéarfaí é/í leo
Legal adoption is permanent
Is buan atá uchtú dlíthiúil
• Adoption orders are made by the Adoption Authority of Ireland
• Déanann Údarás Uchtála na hÉireann orduithe uchtaithe
It also has the power to recognise an adoption made outside the State
Tá an chumhacht aige freisin uchtú a dhéantar lasmuigh den Stát a aithint
It was established in November 2010 under the Adoption Act 2010
Bunaíodh é i mí na Samhna 2010 faoin Acht Uchtaithe 2010
• The 2010 Act also ratified the Convention on Protection of Children and Co-Operation in Respect of Intercountry Adoption (the ‘Hague Convention’)
• Ina theannta sin, daingníodh le hAcht 2010 an Coinbhinsiún maidir le Cosaint Leanaí agus Comhoibriú i leith Uchtú idir Thíortha (‘Coinbhinsiún na Háige’)
The only countries recognised by Ireland for intercountry adoption are those that have also ratified the Hague Convention
Is iad na tíortha amháin a aithníonn Éire le haghaidh uchtú idir thíortha na tíortha sin a dhaingnigh Coinbhinsiún na Háige freisin
The Adoption Authority is the Irish Central Authority under the Convention
Is é an tÚdarás Uchtála Údarás Láir na hÉireann faoin gCoinbhinsiún
In order to adopt a child, you must be at least 21 years of age
D’fhonn leanbh a uchtú, ní mór duit bheith 21 bliain d’aois ar a laghad
You must be ordinarily resident in the State and must have resided in the State for at least one year before the date of the making of the adoption order
Ní mór duit gnáthchónaí a bheith ort sa Stát nó bheith i do chónaí sa Stát ar feadh bliain amháin ar a laghad roimh an dáta ar a ndéantar an t-ordú uchtaithe
The following persons are eligible to adopt:
Tá na daoine seo a leanas i dteideal uchtú:
• A married couple living together
• Lánúin phósta atá ina gcónaí le chéile
• A married person alone
• Duine pósta ina aonar

The other spouse's consent to adopt must be obtained unless the couple is living apart and separated under a court decree or a deed of separation, the other spouse has deserted the prospective adoptive parent or the other spouse's conduct has resulted in the prospective adoptive parent leaving them, with just cause

Ní mór toiliú an chéile eile le huchtú a fháil mura bhfuil an lánúin ina gcónaí ar leithligh óna chéile agus idirscartha faoi fhoraithne chúirte nó faoi ghníomhas idirscartha, nó más rud é gur thréig an céile eile an tuismitheoir uchtála ionchasach nó go raibh iompraíocht an chéile eile ina cúis leis an tuismitheoir uchtála ionchasach ag fágáil an chéile eile, agus cúis chóir aige/aici

• The mother, father or relative of the child (relative meaning a grandparent, brother, sister, uncle or aunt of the child and/or the spouse of any such person, the relationship to the child being traced through the mother or the father)

• Máthair, athair nó gaol an linbh (ciallaíonn gaol seantuismitheoir, deartháir, deirfiúr, uncail nó aintín an linbh agus/nó céile aon duine den chineál sin, agus an ghaolmhaireacht leis an leanbh á rianú tríd an máthair nó tríd an athair)
• A widow or widower
• Baintreach nó baintreach fir
• A sole applicant who is not in one of the categories listed above may only adopt where the Adoption Authority is satisfied that, in the particular circumstances of the case, it is desirable

• Ní fhéadfaidh iarratasóir aonair nach bhfuil i gceann amháin de na catagóirí atá liostaithe thuas uchtú a dhéanamh ach sa chás gur deimhin leis an Údarás Uchtála, in imthosca ar leith an cháis, go bhfuil sé inmhianaithe
It is not possible for two unmarried persons to adopt jointly
Ní féidir le beirt daoine neamhphósta uchtú i gcomhpháirt
The Children and Family Relationships Act 2015 provides that civil partners and cohabiting couples may jointly adopt a child
Soláthraíonn an tAcht Leanaí agus Caidrimh Teaghlaigh 2015 gur féidir páirtnéirí sibhialta agus lánúineacha ag maireachtáil i bhfochair a uchtú i gcomhpháirt le leanbh
The relevant sections of the Act have not yet come into effect
Na hailt ábhartha den Acht nach bhfuil tagtha go fóill i bhfeidhm
There are no legal upper age limits for adopting parents
Níl aon uasteorainneacha aoise i bhfeidhm maidir le tuismitheoirí atá ag uchtú
The Adoption Authority has more information on the eligibility and suitability of those wishing to adopt
Tá tuilleadh faisnéise faoi incháilitheacht agus oiriúnacht na ndaoine ar mian leo uchtú ag an Údarás Uchtála
If you wish to adopt a child from another country, you are required to undergo an assessment of your eligibility and suitability
Más mian leat leanbh a uchtú ó thír eile, tá ceangal ort dul faoi mheasúnú ar d’incháilitheacht agus ar d’oiriúnacht
This is carried out by a social worker from the Tusla intercountry adoption service or an accredited body
Déanann oibrí sóisialta ón tseirbhís um uchtú idir thíortha de chuid Tusla - an Ghníomhaireacht um Leanaí agus an Teaghlach nó comhlacht creidiúnaithe an measúnú sin
The social worker then prepares an intercountry adoption assessment report (also called a home-study report) which goes before the local adoption committee and a recommendation is made

Ullmhaíonn an t-oibrí sóisialta tuarascáil mheasúnaithe ar uchtú idir thíortha (ar a dtugtar tuarascáil staidéar baile freisin) ansin a chuirtear faoi bhráid an choiste uchtála áitiúil agus déantar moladh
Declaration of eligibility and suitability
Dearbhú incháilitheachta agus oiriúnachta
Your application for assessment, the report and the local adoption committee’s recommendations are sent to the Adoption Authority
Cuirtear d’iarratas ar mheasúnú, an tuarascáil agus moltaí an choiste uchtála áitiúil chuig an Údarás Uchtála
If all documents are in place and correct, and the recommendations are positive, the Adoption Authority will grant a declaration of eligibility and suitability
Más i bhfeidhm agus ceart atá na cáipéisí uile, agus más dearfach atá na moltaí, deonóidh an tÚdarás Uchtála dearbhú incháilitheachta agus oiriúnachta

The declaration may include in it a statement relating to the age or state of health of a child whom you are considered suited to parent – this is based on information provided in the assessment report

Is féidir go gcuirfear san áireamh sa dearbhú ráiteas a bhaineann le haois nó le riocht sláinte an linbh a meastar thú a bheith i do thuismitheoir oiriúnach aige/aici - tá sé sin bunaithe ar an bhfaisnéis a chuirtear ar fáil i dtuarascáil an mheasúnaithe
The declaration is granted for a period of 2 years from the date it is issued
Deonaítear an dearbhú ar feadh tréimhse 2 bhliain ón dáta ar a n-eisítear é
The legislation allows for a 1 year extension if necessary, providing circumstances have not changed
Déantar foráil sa reachtaíocht do shíneadh 1 bhliain, ar choinníoll nár tháinig athrú ar imthosca
Choosing a country of origin
Tír thionscnaimh a roghnú
As part of the assessment process, you will have decided on a country from which you wish to adopt a child
Mar chuid den phróiseas measúnaithe, beidh cinneadh déanta agat ar thír ónar mian leat leanbh a uchtú

Under the Adoption Act 2010, Irish residents can only adopt from other countries that have ratified the Hague Convention or from Non-Hague countries with which Ireland has a bi-lateral agreement (Ireland does not currently have any such agreements)

Faoin Acht Uchtaithe 2010, ní fhéadann cónaitheoirí na hÉireann uchtú ach ó thíortha eile a dhaingnigh Coinbhinsiún na Háige nó ó thíortha nach raibh páirteach i gCoinbhinsiún na Háige a bhfuil comhaontú déthaobhach ag Éirinn leo (níl comhaontuithe den chineál sin ag Éirinn faoi láthair)
There is only a small number of Hague Convention countries with which Ireland currently engages for the purposes of intercountry adoption
Níl ach líon beag tíortha de Choinbhinsiún na Háige lena ndéileálann Éire faoi láthair chun críocha uchtú idir thíortha
Each country has its own requirements and restrictions with regard to prospective adopters
Tá a ceanglais agus srianta féin ag gach tír maidir le huchtaitheoirí ionchasacha
Specific information on country requirements may be obtained from the Irish agencies accredited to facilitate adoptions from these countries
Is féidir faisnéis shonrach faoi cheanglais tíre a fháil ó ghníomhaireachtaí Éireannacha atá creidiúnaithe chun uchtuithe ó na tíortha sin a éascú
The process involved in intercountry adoption is governed by protocols set out in the Hague Convention
Rialaítear an próiseas atá i gceist in uchtú idir thíortha le prótacail a leagtar amach i gCoinbhinsiún na Háige

Firstly, the Adoption Authority, or an agency accredited by the Authority for such purposes, submits the intercountry adoption assessment report and the declaration (together known as an Article 15 report) to the Central Authority or an accredited agency in the country you wish to adopt from

Sa chéad dul síos, déanann an tÚdarás Uchtála, nó gníomhaireacht atá creidiúnaithe ag an Údarás chun na críche sin, an tuarascáil mheasúnaithe ar uchtú idir thíortha agus an dearbhú (ar a dtugtar tuarascáil Airteagal 15 i dteannta a chéile) a chur chuig an Údarás Láir nó chuig gníomhaireacht chreidiúnaithe sa tír ónar mian leat uchtú
Matching a child with your application is done in the country of origin of the child
Déantar leanbh a mheaitseáil le d’iarratas i dtír thionscnaimh an linbh

When a match is made, the Central Authority or accredited body in the country of origin of the child sends a child-study report (Article 16 report) to the Adoption Authority or the Irish-based accredited body

Nuair a dhéantar meaits, cuireann an tÚdarás Láir nó an comhlacht creidiúnaithe i dtír thionscnaimh an linbh tuarascáil staidéar linbh (tuarascáil Airteagal 16) chuig an Údarás Uchtála nó chuig an gcomhlacht creidiúnaithe atá lonnaithe in Éirinn

The report will normally contain a background report on the child, the birth-parents (if known), medical history of the child and proof that consents, where applicable, were obtained in the required manner and format

De ghnáth, cuimseoidh an tuarascáil tuarascáil chúlra ar an leanbh, na tuismitheoirí breithe (más eol), stair liachta an linbh agus cruthúnas go bhfuarthas toilithe, más infheidhme, sa mhodh agus san fhormáid a bhí ag teastáil
If the Adoption Authority is satisfied with the suitability of the match, it issues a consent to the placement of the child with you (Article 17)
Más rud é go bhfuil an tÚdarás Uchtála sásta le hoiriúnacht an mheaits, eiseoidh sé toiliú le socrú an linbh leat (Airteagal 17)
You will be informed and asked whether you wish to accept the child
Tabharfar eolas duit agus fiafrófar duit cé acu is mian leat, nó nach mian leat, glacadh leis an leanbh
If you wish, you can travel to the country of origin to see the child before making your decision
Más mian leat, féadfaidh tú taisteal chuig an tír thionscnaimh chun an leanbh a fheiceáil sula ndéanann tú do chinneadh
Either way, you can change your mind up to the time you adopt the child
Bealach amháin nó bealach eile, is féidir leat d’intinn a athrú go dtí an tráth a n-uchtaíonn tú an leanbh

While most countries allow you to adopt the child in the country of origin, there are some who may provide you with guardianship with a view to you obtaining a domestic adoption on your return to Ireland

Cé go dtugann an chuid is mó de thíortha cead duit an leanbh a uchtú sa tír thionscnaimh, is ann do roinnt tíortha a fhéadann caomhnóireacht a chur ar fáil duit le go bhfaigheann tú uchtú intíre ar fhilleadh ar Éirinn duit
Some countries provide guardianship with a requirement that you provide post-placement reports for a prescribed period before finalising the adoption in the courts of the country of origin

Cuireann roinnt tíortha caomhnóireacht ar fáil le ceanglas go gcuireann tú tuarascálacha iarshocrúcháin ar fáil ar feadh tréimhse fhorordaithe sula dtugtar an t-uchtú chun críche i gcúirteanna na tíre tionscnaimh
For the child to enter the state, immigration clearance must be obtained from the Irish Naturalisation and Immigration Service (INIS) in the Department of Justice and Equality
Le gur féidir leis an leanbh an stát a iontráil, ní mór imréiteach inimirce a fháil ó Sheirbhís Eadóirseachta agus Inimirce na hÉireann (INIS) sa Roinn Dlí agus Cirt agus Comhionannais
To request your Immigration Clearance Letter, you need to write to:
D’fhonn do Litir um Imréiteach Inimirce a fháil, ní mór duit scríobh chuig:
Irish Naturalisation and Immigration Service,
Seirbhís Eadóirseachta agus Inimirce na hÉireann,
3rd Floor, 13/14 Burgh Quay, Dublin 2
An Chéad Urlár, 13/14 Cé an Bhúrcaigh, Baile Átha Cliath 2
You will need to enclose:
Beidh ort na nithe seo a leanas a iamh:
• A letter of application that includes a daytime contact number
• Litir iarratais ina gcuirtear uimhir theagmhála am lae san áireamh
• A photocopy of your passport (and your spouse's)
• Fótachóip de do phas (agus de phas do chéile)
• Two passport size photographs of you (and two of your spouse)
• Dhá ghrianghraf de mhéid pas díot (agus dhá cheann de do chéile)
• The Declaration of Eligibility and Suitability (not a copy)
• Dearbhú Incháilitheachta agus Oiriúnachta (ní ghlacfar le cóip)
• A letter from the Adoption Authority stating how many children you can adopt and from what country
• Litir ón Údarás Uchtála ina sonraítear cá mhéad leanbh is féidir leat a uchtú agus na tíortha ar féidir leat iad a uchtú uathu
These will be returned to you with your Immigration Clearance Letter, when approved
Tabharfar iad sin ar ais duit mar aon le do Litir um Imréiteach Inimirce, agus í formheasta
You will need to present this letter to an immigration officer when you return to Ireland
Beidh ort an litir a thaispeáint d’oifigeach inimirce ar fhilleadh ar Éirinn duit
Notification of Adoption Authority
Fógra a thabhairt don Údarás Uchtála
You must notify the Adoption Authority and Tusla when you bring the child to Ireland for the first time after adoption in the country of origin
Ní mór duit fógra a thabhairt don Údarás Uchtála agus do Tusla nuair a thugann tú an leanbh d’Éirinn leat den chéad uair tar éis uchtú sa tír thionscnaimh
They must also be notified if you bring the child to Ireland in order to adopt the child here
Ní mór fógra a thabhairt dó freisin más rud é go dtugann tú an leanbh d’Éirinn leat d’fhonn an leanbh a uchtú anseo
This should be done as soon as you can and must be done within 3 months
Ba cheart é sin a dhéanamh a luaithe is féidir agus is gá é a dhéanamh laistigh de 3 mhí
If the child was adopted in the country of origin, the final step in the intercountry adoption process is the registration of the adoption
Más rud é gur uchtaíodh an leanbh sa tír thionscnaimh, is é an chéim dheiridh den phróiseas um uchtú idir thíortha ná clárú an uchtaithe
This is the formal, legal recognition of the adoption by the Irish State
Is aitheantas dlíthiúil foirmiúil é sin don uchtú a thugann an Stát Éireannach
You must submit an application for registration of the adoption to the Adoption Authority within 3 months of re-entering the State, following the adoption
Ní mór duit iarratas ar chlárú an uchtaithe a chur faoi bhráid an Údaráis Uchtála laistigh de 3 mhí tar éis duit an Stát a athiontráil i ndiaidh an uchtaithe
The Authority can register the adoption in the Register of Intercountry Adoptions on the basis of an Article 23 certificate
Is féidir leis an Údarás an t-uchtú a chlárú sa Chlár um Uchtuithe Idir Thíortha ar bhonn theastas Airteagal 23
(An Article 23 certificate is a certificate of assurance from the country of origin of your child that the adoption was carried out in compliance with the Hague Convention.)
(Is é is teastas Airteagal 23 ann ná teastas dearbhaithe ó thír thionscnaimh do linbh gur comhlíonadh Coinbhinsiún na Háige agus an t-uchtú á dhéanamh.)
The Register of Intercountry Adoptions contains details of the adopted child and the adoptive parents and is a public document open to scrutiny by members of the public
Cuimsíonn an Clár um Uchtuithe Idir Thíortha sonraí faoin leanbh uchtaithe agus faoi na tuismitheoirí uchtála agus is cáipéis phoiblí í ar féidir le baill den phobal í a iniúchadh
Certificates or copies of extracts from the Register may be obtained from the Authority for the appropriate fee and serve for all legal purposes as a birth certificate for your child
Féadfar teastais nó cóipeanna de shleachta an Chláir a fháil ón Údarás ach an táille iomchuí a íoc agus feidhmíonn siad chun críocha dlí mar theastas breithe i gcomhair do linbh
Some countries require that you provide information on the child’s ongoing condition and progress following adoption
Éilíonn roinnt tíortha go gcuireann tú faisnéis ar fáil faoi riocht agus dhul chun cinn leanúnach an linbh tar éis uchtú
This information is usually provided in reports known as post-adoption reports
Cuirtear an fhaisnéis sin ar fáil de ghnáth i dtuarascálacha ar a dtugtar tuarascálacha tar éis uchtú
These reports are normally compiled by social workers or agencies accredited by the Adoption Authority to provide such services
Is gnách go gcuireann oibrithe sóisialta nó gníomhaireachtaí atá creidiúnaithe ag an Údarás Uchtála chun na seirbhísí sin a chur ar fáil na tuarascálacha sin i dtoll a chéile
If you have an enquiry about intercountry adoption, contact your local Tusla intercountry adoption office
Más rud é go bhfuil fiosrú agat maidir le huchtú idir thíortha, déan teagmháil leis an oifig um uchtú idir thíortha is cóngaraí duit de chuid na Gníomhaireachta um Leanaí agus an Teaghlach
A certified copy of an entry in the Register of Intercountry Adoptions, which can be used for legal and administrative purposes, costs €10
Tá costas €10 ar chóip dheimhnithe d’iontráil sa Chlár um Uchtuithe Idir Thíortha, rud is féidir a úsáid chun críocha dlí agus riaracháin
It is available from the Adoption Authority
Tá sí ar fáil ón Údarás Uchtála
You can download an application form here (pdf)
Is féidir leat foirm iarratais a íoslódáil nó iarratas a dhéanamh ar líne anseo (pdf)
The Adoption Authority has information on the intercountry adoption process as well as frequently asked questions on its website
Ar a láithreán Gréasáin, tá faisnéis faoin bpróiseas um uchtú idir thíortha mar aon le ceisteanna coitianta ag an Údarás Uchtála
